TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit KerberosRequestorSecurityToken extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken

Docs.summary: Represents a security token that is based upon a Kerberos ticket that is sent in an SOAP request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, application developers do not need to use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> class, unless a Web service must get the service principal name associated with the Kerberos ticket. To get the value of the service principal name, get the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.ServicePrincipalName%2A> property.
There are two classes that represent security tokens that are based upon a Kerberos ticket: <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosReceiverSecurityToken>. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token is used by clients that use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token in an outgoing SOAP messages, whereas the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosReceiverSecurityToken> security token is used by a Web service that receives SOAP messages that contain the security token.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string servicePrincipalName) cil managed

Docs.param: The service principal name for the security token. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a service that is associated with the specified service principal name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The service principal name must be in one of the following formats: `host/<hostname>@<domain>` or `<hostname>`, where `hostname` is the name of the computer hosting the target Web service and `domain` is the fully-qualified domain name of the Kerberos realm in which the host computer resides. The service principal name is associated with an account that is running the service and this mapping is stored in the Kerberos Domain Controller (KDC).

Docs.exception: A Kerberos ticket cannot be obtained for the current user.

MemberSignature.Value: public KerberosRequestorSecurityToken (string servicePrincipalName, System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel tokenImpersonationLevel, System.Net.NetworkCredential networkCredential, string id);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string servicePrincipalName, valuetype System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel tokenImpersonationLevel, class System.Net.NetworkCredential networkCredential, string id) cil managed

public: KerberosRequestorSecurityToken(System::String ^ servicePrincipalName, System::Security::Principal::TokenImpersonationLevel tokenImpersonationLevel, System::Net::NetworkCredential ^ networkCredential, System::String ^ id);

Docs.param: The service principal name for the security token. Sets the property.
One of the values that specifies how the client allows the security token to be impersonated.
A that specifies the user to get a security token for.
A unique identifier of the security token. Sets the value of the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The service principal name must be in one of the following formats: `host/<hostname>@<domain>` or `<hostname>`, where `hostname` is the name of the computer hosting the target Web service and `domain` is the fully-qualified domain name of the Kerberos realm in which the host computer resides. The service principal name is associated with an account that is running the service and this mapping is stored in the Kerberos Domain Controller (KDC).
When `null` is passed into the `networkCredential` parameter, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token is obtained for the current user.

Docs.exception: is not , not equal to and the property is empty or .
A Kerberos ticket cannot be obtained for the specified user.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To create the key identifier clause, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method.

Docs.returns: A that is a key identifier clause for the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To determine whether the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> class can create the specified key identifier clause, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method.

Docs.returns: An array of that contains the result Kerberos ticket request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Kerberos ticket request is made using the `InitializeSecurityContext` API.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SecurityKey As SymmetricSecurityKey

Docs.summary: Gets the symmetric session key for the Kerberos ticket that is associated with this security token.
Docs.value: A that contains the symmetric session key for the Kerberos ticket that is associated with this security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.SecurityKey%2A> property is set when one of the constructors is called with the symmetric session key for the Kerberos ticket that is obtained for the specified user.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property SecurityKeys As ReadOnlyCollection(Of SecurityKey)

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
Docs.value: A of type that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.SecurityKeys%2A> property contains the symmetric session key in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosReceiverSecurityToken.SecurityKey%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ServicePrincipalName As String
public: property System::String ^ ServicePrincipalName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the service principal name for the security token.
Docs.value: The service principal name for the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The service principal name may be in one of the following formats: `host/<hostname>@<domain>` or `<hostname>`, where `hostname` is the name of the computer hosting the target Web service and `domain` is the fully-qualified domain name of the Kerberos realm in which the host computer resides.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ValidFrom As DateTime
public: virtual property DateTime ValidFrom { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to the instant in time when the Kerberos ticket is obtained in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ValidTo As DateTime
public: virtual property DateTime ValidTo { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to the instant in time when the Kerberos ticket expires in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
